Email as a Service! Have fun...

crypto.name: RSA 1
crypto.desc:
noob-abhinav

Yú Tóngyī send a message to 3 peoples with unique modulus. But he left it vulnerable. Figure out :)

crypto.name: Secure Server
crypto.desc:
NoobMaster

John Doe uses this secure server where plaintext is never shared. Our Forensics Analyst was able to capture this traffic and the source code for the server. Can you recover John Doe's secrets?

crypto.name: Secure Server 2
crypto.desc:
NoobMaster

This time, the server is even more secure, but did it actually receive the secret? Simple brute-force won't work!

i accidentally vanished my flag, can u find it for me

Some might call this a programming challenge...

misc.name: Enchant
misc.desc:
NoobMaster

I was playing minecraft, and found this strange enchantment on the enchantment table. Can you figure out what it is? Wrap the flag in scriptCTF{}

misc.name: Subtract
misc.desc:
NoobMaster

The image size is 500x500. You might want to remove some stuff... Note: Some may call it guessy!

misc.name: emoji
misc.desc:
noob-abhinav

Emojis everywhere! Is it a joke? Or something is hiding behind it.

programming.name: Back From Where
programming.desc:
Connor Chang

On a grid, you begin on the top left, moving right and down until reaching the bottom right, multiplying every number you encounter on the path. Find the maximum number of trailing zeroes for every node. Note: You might want to check out BackFromBrazil from n00bzctf 2024.

(if you have any questions about input/output, plz open a ticket)

programming.name: Sums
programming.desc:
Connor Chang

Find the sum of a[i] for i in [l, r] (if there are any issues with input/output format, plz open a ticket)

programming.name: Windows To Infinity
programming.desc: windows and windows and windows and windows and windows and winflag???? (if there are any questions about input/output format, plz open a ticket)

pwn.name: Index
pwn.desc:
NoobMaster

I literally hand you the flag, just exploit it already!

pwn.name: Index 2
pwn.desc:
NoobMaster

This time, you get the file pointer, not the flag itself.

pwn.name: Vault 2
pwn.desc:
Connor Chang

Welcome to Connor's Fantastic Vault, where you can store all your valuables. All valuables are encrypted before stored, to ensure noone's data is compromised if anything goes wrong! (Note: wrap the flag and submit in the format scriptCTF{0xdeadbeefdeadbeef})

pwn.name: Vault 3
pwn.desc:
Connor Chang

Welcome to Connor's Fantastic Vault, where you can store all you valuables. We have gone through many renovations in our security and hopefully there should be no more hacks in our system. (Note: this binary uses glibc version 2.30 without tcache)

pwn.name: vault
pwn.desc:
Connor Chang

Congragulations to be part of Connor's Fantastic Vault's prelaunch. You can feel safe to store whatever you want in our vault without risk of compromise.
